metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3458 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 6u115, 7u101, and 8u92; and Java SE Embedded 8u91 allows remote attackers to affect integrity via vectors related to CORBA. A vulnerability was discovered in the OpenJDK JRE related to data integrity. An attacker could exploit this to expose sensitive data over the network or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1
openjdk-8-jre - 8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1
openjdk-8-jre-jamvm - 8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1
openjdk-8-source - 8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8u91-b14-3ubuntu1~16.04.1').
